title: Can't connect to server after 6.9 update. HELP.
body:
After the new patch 6.9 i am unable to log into my league client. It just comes up with the pop up msg saying that i cannot connect to server.

any ideas?

replies.body:
Hey

Can you try opening the following two URLs in a web browser.  If it is working correctly, it should show a blank white page.  Let me know if one/both of these fail to load for you:

* https://lq.oc1.lol.riotgames.com/
* https://prod.oc1.lol.riotgames.com:2099

Cheers!
Mindstar

Hey thanks for replying, 
Neither of the pages would load.

Well that will be a problem - especially if you can't hit the first one.

Try going through the "changing your dns" section in the support article on [Troubleshooting Connection Issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5) and see if that fixes it up.

Let me know how you go
I have same problem aswell, and nothing here works.

1. I did this and it is not working, I cant reconnect to chat server and my last game I couldnt even join too afraid to be banned I wont join a game til this issue is fixed, sometimes I have problems even getting into the client everything else works but since 6.9 I can't do shit

mine is doing the same thing. it wont load and keeps attempting to connect to server. i did as you said and i get blank pages on both. is there a problem with the server do you know?? and is there anything else i can do to help get back to playing lol

If anyone is using Windows 10, DNS errors can run rampant if you have 3rd party VPN software or if you ever had to install or reinstall a network adapter.  I advise following Riot's support documents first, but to troubleshoot DNS issues you will want to look into manually setting your DNS server addresses for your network interface and look into the NSLOOKUP command for the Windows shell console. 

If you've made changes to your router configuration or your host computer firewall, definitely start there first as DNS can be configured on most home routers and if your firewall is blocking port 53 for TCP/UDP that could be the culprit as DNS checks run on that path. 

Hope this helps a little.  It can be very frustrating...
my league is doing the exact same thing. i cant login
i can login but i cant connect to chat or do anything, riot helppp
dw i fixed it just Disable Peer to Peer transfers from the Gear menu in the top right corner of the Patcher
